summary: I’m fired I meant to post this moodboard for my wife’s OC x Shoto when I made it For @thatweirdrandomone​  🇦​🇳​🇩​🇮​ 🇲​🇪​🇾​🇮​🇪​🇷​...
caption:
I’m fired I meant to post this moodboard for my wife’s OC x Shoto when I made it

For @thatweirdrandomone​

🇦​🇳​🇩​🇮​ 🇲​🇪​🇾​🇮​🇪​🇷​

Age: 17

Quirk: emotional projection; calming and or confusing

Height: 5’5”

Weight: 120lbs

Hair: Shoulder length wavy light brown hair; mostly down

Eye Color: light green eyes

Defining Traits: long legs shorter torso, round face, medium sized bust, Likes to wear layers of clothing on top and leggings on bottom most of the time.

Personality: Sweet, caring, gets lost in her own thoughts, likes to help others, gets bursts of energy here and there making her bubbly, likes to be low key, loves outdoors

Occupation: Student in general studies/American transfer program

Ship: Shoto Todoroki

“Squad” includes hanging around Momo Yaoyorozu, Tsuyu Asui, Hitoshi Shinso, Deku, Iida Tenya and Kyoka Jiro

Goals: To prove that mind quirks are strong and that her striving to become a pro hero isn’t hindered by the fact she isn’t outwardly strong or overly charismatic 

Well there you go! I’ll get around to posting my own OC eventually but my wife’s was a little easier to due since she was a student.

title: Polaroid
body:
Summary: Shinsou Hitoshi can’t sleep. When he was in General Studies, no one understood why someone like him had insomnia. “What are you afraid of?” They’d pry. Shinsou never told them. It wasn’t worth explaining to someone who wouldn’t understand. But when insomnia strikes an hour past midnight, Shinsou ventures into the common room, seeking a distraction.

That distraction happens to be named Kaminari Denki, and unlike the General Studies class, he has insomnia too.

Notes: Heavily inspired by the song ‘Polaroid’ by Imagine Dragons and some art by @noerher. Considering its spring break and I’m stuck on campus in the middle of Arizona, I thought I’d get some writing done.

Rated T

                                                        Polaroid

1 AM. Of course he couldn’t sleep.

Shinsou rolled over and rubbed his eyes. The darkness of his room did little to aid his insomnia. No matter how dark, no matter how quiet, he would be awake nonetheless.

Shinsou sighed and stretched his arms above his head. If only there was a quirk that could send him to sleep – he’d become that user’s best friend. On the bright side, at least it was a weekend. Since he didn’t have to wake up early for school, he could sleep in – if he ever fell asleep in the first place.

He turned on his bedside lamp. The light flooded his room and he glanced away to avoid being blinded. At least he had a room to himself. Shinsou didn’t have to worry about waking a roommate with his midnight antics.

His eyes adjusted to the light. If he wasn’t going to sleep, he needed to figure out something else to do. But what?

He’d only moved into the 1-A dorms a few weeks ago. It was still hard to believe. He’d been admitted into the hero course in their second year, and while he had a lot of catching up to do, he was there nonetheless. It was almost surreal. He’d dreamed of that moment for months, but when it actually happened, he was wholly unprepared.

Since he’d just moved in, the dorm room was bare. UA provided the essentials – a bed, desk, cabinets. The only thing Shinsou added was a cork board filled with Polaroid photos. He didn’t consider himself a photography fanatic, but there was something about the timelessness of polaroids that drew his attention. It was more than a photo, it was a moment frozen in time.

He kept photos of his classmates, even some of himself, and pinned them to the board to remind him why he joined class 1-A.

Now that his room was illuminated, he could observe each photo. He kept them because of the feeling the pictures gave him – or was it the feeling the people in them gave him?

He picked up the first photo. Kaminari stood with his arm slung around Shinsou’s shoulders. Kaminari wore Shinsou’s speaker around his mouth and a scarf around his neck. Shinsou had Kaminari’s jacket around his arms. They’d traded costumes for the day.

Shinsou smiled faintly. The speaker around Kaminari’s mouth was more like a muzzle. Shinsou refused to show him how to use it, so each word from Kaminari’s mouth came out muffled and faint. It was one of the few times Shinsou had seen him be completely silent. It was nice, but he quickly grew to miss the chatter.

The leather jacket had stuck to his skin and the shooters around his wrists weighed him down. How did Kaminari move like that? Shinsou could hardly fight properly with them.

He put a picture back and pulled up another one.

Shinsou wasn’t sure who had taken it. One of their classmates, for sure. It was candid – neither of them were aware the photo was taken. A student must have dug the camera out of Shinsou’s bag while they were training.

It was some kind of partner exercise. It was early in the year, so Shinsou couldn’t recall the exact event. Kaminari stood back to back with him, electricity pulsing through his fingertips. Shinsou stared at something off a frame, already tugging at the ropes around his neck. Kaminari seemed to be saying something, but Shinsou couldn’t remember what.

No, he couldn’t remember what they were doing or what was said, but he could remember how it made him feel. Kaminari covering him, watching his back. For the first time in a long time, Shinsou felt…safe. Like there was someone he could trust.

It was usually a rare feeling for him, but not when he was around Kaminari.

One more photo caught his attention.

They’d all had the day off for a teacher’s work day. Despite Aizawa’s objections, Nedzu allowed the students to leave campus. The entirety of class 1-A packed into a bus and rode to the beach – with the exception of Mineta, whose invitation had mysteriously disappeared.

Somehow, Shinsou was roped into playing a game of chicken fight. He still wasn’t sure how that had happened. He only vaguely remembered Kaminari grabbing his arm and begging for Shinsou to join.

Kaminari teamed up with Sero, leaving Shinsou with Kirishima. Not a bad choice in partners, but Shinsou wished he could have paired with Kaminari instead of fighting against him.

The photo was taken seconds before they hit the water. Shinsou’s hands were locked on Kaminari’s shoulders, who in turn had clasped Shinsou’s elbows. They wore identical smiles. Kaminari’s hair was wet, dripping over his eyes.

If Shinsou remembered correctly, they’d hit the water at the same time, making the fight a draw.

He put the pictures back, sure to pin them in place so they didn’t fall.

At least he felt better, though he still couldn’t sleep. He picked his camera off his nightstand and tossed it between his hands. Maybe he should take a walk around campus. There could be something new or exciting for him to take a picture of.

He threw a jacket on and opened the door.

Since he lived near the end of the hall, he’d have to cross the common room before he could leave. Hopefully, he didn’t run into anyone who’d try to stop him or ask questions. He only just joined the hero course – he couldn’t start making enemies with his teachers so soon.

No such luck.

He made it a few feet before he saw the light burning in the common room. It was faint, tinted blue, as if someone was using their phone. Shinsou peered around the corner, staying as hidden as he could. If it was a teacher, he’d get in trouble for sneaking out. Not just any trouble, either, but kicked-out-of-the-class-he-worked-so-hard-for trouble.

“Oh. Hey. What’re you doing up?”

Shinsou stiffened. Dammit. He needed to work on a lot of skills to be on par with the 1-A kids. It seemed stealth should be at the top of his list.

The student lifted their head over the couch, revealing Kaminari’s black-striped hair. Shinsou relaxed, exhaling.

“Couldn’t sleep,” Shinsou said. He pushed away from the corner and made his way into the common room. “Any teachers around?”

“No. It’s Vlad King’s turn to watch the dorms tonight. He sleeps like a rock.” Kaminari said. He sat up, revealing a long white wire. Earbuds. The light Shinsou saw must have been from Kaminari’s iPod.

“What are you doing up?”

“Nightmares,” Kaminari settled back down into the couch, trying too hard to seem nonchalant. The crack in his voice gave him away.

“From the summer camp?” Shinsou asked, taking a seat across from him.

“No,” Kaminari said. “The USJ attack.”

“Oh, right.” Sometimes Shinsou forgot the first attack took place. Everything happened so fast that it faded from the news before anyone could stop it.

“I avoided the worst of it during the summer camp since I was inside the entire time. But USJ? Front lines, baby, front lines.”

Kaminari trailed off, hyper-focusing his attention to his music. He skipped a few songs before he was satisfied. “I remember electrocuting too many villains to count. And then,” he waved his hands haphazardly. “I short-circuited. Couldn’t do anything. Couldn’t move. Couldn’t think. But I could still feel.” Kaminari tapped his chest, right above his heart.

“When another villain and grabbed me from behind…nothing I could do to stop it. But I still felt the fear. No, it was more than fear. It was helplessness. Knowing I was in danger – that my friends were in danger – and I couldn’t do anything about it.”

“I can’t imagine what it feels like,” Shinsou mumbled

“If you’re lucky, you’ll never have to,” Kaminari said. “What about you? What’s keeping you up?”

“General feelings,” Shinsou said.

“I’m afraid there’s too many of those going around.” Kaminari snorted. He held up the iPod. “Want to listen? It’s my night-time playlist. Effects have mostly worn off on me, but maybe you’ll find something that helps.”

“The earbuds aren’t long enough.”

“Here,” Kaminari squished himself further back into the couch. “Come sit.”

Shinsou’s heart skipped a beat. “Ok,” he said. “Ok.”

He climbed onto the cushions beside Kaminari. Even if Kaminari moved over, the couch wasn’t big enough for both of them. Not by a long shot. Kaminari’s legs pressed against his. The couch beneath him was still warm.

Kaminari shifted onto his side to face Shinsou. “Here,” he pulled an earbud loose and handed it over. “It’s not too loud. I promise.”

Shinsou accepted it.

Kaminari’s ‘night-time’ playlist was nothing Shinsou had expected from him. The music was soft, gentle. Slow, even. “What artist is this?”

“Vance Joy,” Kaminari said. “But there’s more on here than just him.”

“It’s in English.”

“Music is a universal language.” Kaminari’s voice was barely a whisper. “It doesn’t matter where you come from or where you go. A note is still a note.”

“Must be nice to have something that absolute in your life,” Shinsou noted.

“I suppose it is.”

Shinsou closed his eyes and tried to see the music the way Kaminari saw it. To feel it. To hear it as a language spoken across borders.

But he couldn’t focus on the song.

How could he? Even with his eyes closed, he could feel Kaminari’s gaze on him. “What is it?” Shinsou asked.

“Don’t you have anything in your life that’s…how’d you put it? Absolute?”

“No,” Shinsou answered a little too quickly; he wasn’t methodical enough to remove the bitterness from his voice. “Nothing,” he amended, trying to sound lighter.

Kaminari didn’t buy it. “Not even a person?”

“I wish I did,” Shinsou said. “But they come and go so fast they’re hardly temporary, much less absolute.”

“What if there was someone who didn’t leave you?” Kaminari asked. “Would you feel absolute then?”

“I guess so,” Shinsou said. “But I doubt I’ll ever know.”

“Right.” Kaminari shifted, lifting his gaze away. Something in his voice sounded different, but Shinsou couldn’t tell what. “Just listen to the music. Maybe you’ll fall asleep.”

“Maybe.”

Shinsou took a deep breath and tried again to listen to the music like Kaminari. To feel the beat in his fingertips, the life in its words.

Before long, he was asleep.

He woke up to someone scraping across the floor on their way to the bathroom. He opened his eyes and blinked away the light flooding his vision. Kaminari was long gone – his side of the couch was cold.

In his place, Kaminari had tucked the second earbud into Shinsou’s ear. On the coffee table in front of him, Shinsou’s polaroid camera lay on its side and next to it, a single photo; Shinsou, asleep on the couch, illuminated by the glow of the iPod.

Scrawled across the bottom in Kaminari’s sloppy handwriting read; Absolute.

“When another villain and grabbed me from behind…nothing I could do to stop it. But I still felt the fear. No, it was more than fear. It was helplessness. Knowing I was in danger – that my friends were in danger – and I couldn’t do anything about it.”

“I can’t imagine what it feels like,” Shinsou mumbled

“If you’re lucky, you’ll never have to,” Kaminari said. “What about you? What’s keeping you up?”

“General feelings,” Shinsou said.

“I’m afraid there’s too many of those going around.” Kaminari snorted. He held up the iPod. “Want to listen? It’s my night-time playlist. Effects have mostly worn off on me, but maybe you’ll find something that helps.”

“The earbuds aren’t long enough.”

“Here,” Kaminari squished himself further back into the couch. “Come sit.”

Shinsou’s heart skipped a beat. “Ok,” he said. “Ok.”

He climbed onto the cushions beside Kaminari. Even if Kaminari moved over, the couch wasn’t big enough for both of them. Not by a long shot. Kaminari’s legs pressed against his. The couch beneath him was still warm.

Kaminari shifted onto his side to face Shinsou. “Here,” he pulled an earbud loose and handed it over. “It’s not too loud. I promise.”

Shinsou accepted it.

Kaminari’s ‘night-time’ playlist was nothing Shinsou had expected from him. The music was soft, gentle. Slow, even. “What artist is this?”

“Vance Joy,” Kaminari said. “But there’s more on here than just him.”

“It’s in English.”

“Music is a universal language.” Kaminari’s voice was barely a whisper. “It doesn’t matter where you come from or where you go. A note is still a note.”

“Must be nice to have something that absolute in your life,” Shinsou noted.

“I suppose it is.”

Shinsou closed his eyes and tried to see the music the way Kaminari saw it. To feel it. To hear it as a language spoken across borders.

But he couldn’t focus on the song.

How could he? Even with his eyes closed, he could feel Kaminari’s gaze on him. “What is it?” Shinsou asked.

“Don’t you have anything in your life that’s…how’d you put it? Absolute?”

“No,” Shinsou answered a little too quickly; he wasn’t methodical enough to remove the bitterness from his voice. “Nothing,” he amended, trying to sound lighter.

Kaminari didn’t buy it. “Not even a person?”

“I wish I did,” Shinsou said. “But they come and go so fast they’re hardly temporary, much less absolute.”

“What if there was someone who didn’t leave you?” Kaminari asked. “Would you feel absolute then?”

“I guess so,” Shinsou said. “But I doubt I’ll ever know.”

“Right.” Kaminari shifted, lifting his gaze away. Something in his voice sounded different, but Shinsou couldn’t tell what. “Just listen to the music. Maybe you’ll fall asleep.”

“Maybe.”

Shinsou took a deep breath and tried again to listen to the music like Kaminari. To feel the beat in his fingertips, the life in its words.

Before long, he was asleep.

He woke up to someone scraping across the floor on their way to the bathroom. He opened his eyes and blinked away the light flooding his vision. Kaminari was long gone – his side of the couch was cold.

In his place, Kaminari had tucked the second earbud into Shinsou’s ear. On the coffee table in front of him, Shinsou’s polaroid camera lay on its side and next to it, a single photo; Shinsou, asleep on the couch, illuminated by the glow of the iPod.

Scrawled across the bottom in Kaminari’s sloppy handwriting read; Absolute.

It wasn’t worth explaining to someone who wouldn’t understand. But when insomnia strikes an hour past midnight, Shinsou ventures into the common room, seeking a distraction.

That distraction happens to be named Kaminari Denki, and unlike the General Studies class, he has insomnia too.

Notes: Heavily inspired by the song ‘Polaroid’ by Imagine Dragons and some art by @noerher. Considering its spring break and I’m stuck on campus in the middle of Arizona, I thought I’d get some writing done.

Rated T

                                                        Polaroid

1 AM. Of course he couldn’t sleep.

Shinsou rolled over and rubbed his eyes. The darkness of his room did little to aid his insomnia. No matter how dark, no matter how quiet, he would be awake nonetheless.

Shinsou sighed and stretched his arms above his head. If only there was a quirk that could send him to sleep – he’d become that user’s best friend. On the bright side, at least it was a weekend. Since he didn’t have to wake up early for school, he could sleep in – if he ever fell asleep in the first place.

He turned on his bedside lamp. The light flooded his room and he glanced away to avoid being blinded. At least he had a room to himself. Shinsou didn’t have to worry about waking a roommate with his midnight antics.

His eyes adjusted to the light. If he wasn’t going to sleep, he needed to figure out something else to do. But what?

He’d only moved into the 1-A dorms a few weeks ago. It was still hard to believe. He’d been admitted into the hero course in their second year, and while he had a lot of catching up to do, he was there nonetheless. It was almost surreal. He’d dreamed of that moment for months, but when it actually happened, he was wholly unprepared.

Since he’d just moved in, the dorm room was bare. UA provided the essentials – a bed, desk, cabinets. The only thing Shinsou added was a cork board filled with Polaroid photos. He didn’t consider himself a photography fanatic, but there was something about the timelessness of polaroids that drew his attention. It was more than a photo, it was a moment frozen in time.

He kept photos of his classmates, even some of himself, and pinned them to the board to remind him why he joined class 1-A.

Now that his room was illuminated, he could observe each photo. He kept them because of the feeling the pictures gave him – or was it the feeling the people in them gave him?

He picked up the first photo. Kaminari stood with his arm slung around Shinsou’s shoulders. Kaminari wore Shinsou’s speaker around his mouth and a scarf around his neck. Shinsou had Kaminari’s jacket around his arms. They’d traded costumes for the day.

Shinsou smiled faintly. The speaker around Kaminari’s mouth was more like a muzzle. Shinsou refused to show him how to use it, so each word from Kaminari’s mouth came out muffled and faint. It was one of the few times Shinsou had seen him be completely silent. It was nice, but he quickly grew to miss the chatter.

The leather jacket had stuck to his skin and the shooters around his wrists weighed him down. How did Kaminari move like that? Shinsou could hardly fight properly with them.

He put a picture back and pulled up another one.

Shinsou wasn’t sure who had taken it. One of their classmates, for sure. It was candid – neither of them were aware the photo was taken. A student must have dug the camera out of Shinsou’s bag while they were training.

It was some kind of partner exercise. It was early in the year, so Shinsou couldn’t recall the exact event. Kaminari stood back to back with him, electricity pulsing through his fingertips. Shinsou stared at something off a frame, already tugging at the ropes around his neck. Kaminari seemed to be saying something, but Shinsou couldn’t remember what.

No, he couldn’t remember what they were doing or what was said, but he could remember how it made him feel. Kaminari covering him, watching his back. For the first time in a long time, Shinsou felt…safe. Like there was someone he could trust.

It was usually a rare feeling for him, but not when he was around Kaminari.

[[MORE]]

One more photo caught his attention.

They’d all had the day off for a teacher’s work day. Despite Aizawa’s objections, Nedzu allowed the students to leave campus. The entirety of class 1-A packed into a bus and rode to the beach – with the exception of Mineta, whose invitation had mysteriously disappeared.

Somehow, Shinsou was roped into playing a game of chicken fight. He still wasn’t sure how that had happened. He only vaguely remembered Kaminari grabbing his arm and begging for Shinsou to join.

Kaminari teamed up with Sero, leaving Shinsou with Kirishima. Not a bad choice in partners, but Shinsou wished he could have paired with Kaminari instead of fighting against him.

The photo was taken seconds before they hit the water. Shinsou’s hands were locked on Kaminari’s shoulders, who in turn had clasped Shinsou’s elbows. They wore identical smiles. Kaminari’s hair was wet, dripping over his eyes.

If Shinsou remembered correctly, they’d hit the water at the same time, making the fight a draw.

He put the pictures back, sure to pin them in place so they didn’t fall.

At least he felt better, though he still couldn’t sleep. He picked his camera off his nightstand and tossed it between his hands. Maybe he should take a walk around campus. There could be something new or exciting for him to take a picture of.

He threw a jacket on and opened the door.

Since he lived near the end of the hall, he’d have to cross the common room before he could leave. Hopefully, he didn’t run into anyone who’d try to stop him or ask questions. He only just joined the hero course – he couldn’t start making enemies with his teachers so soon.

No such luck.

He made it a few feet before he saw the light burning in the common room. It was faint, tinted blue, as if someone was using their phone. Shinsou peered around the corner, staying as hidden as he could. If it was a teacher, he’d get in trouble for sneaking out. Not just any trouble, either, but kicked-out-of-the-class-he-worked-so-hard-for trouble.

“Oh. Hey. What’re you doing up?”

Shinsou stiffened. Dammit. He needed to work on a lot of skills to be on par with the 1-A kids. It seemed stealth should be at the top of his list.

The student lifted their head over the couch, revealing Kaminari’s black-striped hair. Shinsou relaxed, exhaling.

“Couldn’t sleep,” Shinsou said. He pushed away from the corner and made his way into the common room. “Any teachers around?”

“No. It’s Vlad King’s turn to watch the dorms tonight. He sleeps like a rock.” Kaminari said. He sat up, revealing a long white wire. Earbuds. The light Shinsou saw must have been from Kaminari’s iPod.

“What are you doing up?”

“Nightmares,” Kaminari settled back down into the couch, trying too hard to seem nonchalant. The crack in his voice gave him away.

“From the summer camp?” Shinsou asked, taking a seat across from him.

“No,” Kaminari said. “The USJ attack.”

“Oh, right.” Sometimes Shinsou forgot the first attack took place. Everything happened so fast that it faded from the news before anyone could stop it.

“I can’t imagine what it feels like,” Shinsou mumbled

“I’m afraid there’s too many of those going around.” Kaminari snorted. He held up the iPod. “Want to listen? It’s my night-time playlist. Effects have mostly worn off on me, but maybe you’ll find something that helps.”

“The earbuds aren’t long enough.”

“Here,” Kaminari squished himself further back into the couch. “Come sit.”

Shinsou’s heart skipped a beat. “Ok,” he said. “Ok.”

He climbed onto the cushions beside Kaminari. Even if Kaminari moved over, the couch wasn’t big enough for both of them. Not by a long shot. Kaminari’s legs pressed against his. The couch beneath him was still warm.

Kaminari shifted onto his side to face Shinsou. “Here,” he pulled an earbud loose and handed it over. “It’s not too loud. I promise.”

Shinsou accepted it.

“Vance Joy,” Kaminari said. “But there’s more on here than just him.”

“It’s in English.”

“Must be nice to have something that absolute in your life,” Shinsou noted.

“I suppose it is.”

But he couldn’t focus on the song.

How could he? Even with his eyes closed, he could feel Kaminari’s gaze on him. “What is it?” Shinsou asked.

“No,” Shinsou answered a little too quickly; he wasn’t methodical enough to remove the bitterness from his voice. “Nothing,” he amended, trying to sound lighter.

“I wish I did,” Shinsou said. “But they come and go so fast they’re hardly temporary, much less absolute.”

“What if there was someone who didn’t leave you?” Kaminari asked. “Would you feel absolute then?”

“I guess so,” Shinsou said. “But I doubt I’ll ever know.”

“Right.” Kaminari shifted, lifting his gaze away. Something in his voice sounded different, but Shinsou couldn’t tell what. “Just listen to the music. Maybe you’ll fall asleep.”

“Maybe.”

Shinsou took a deep breath and tried again to listen to the music like Kaminari. To feel the beat in his fingertips, the life in its words.

Before long, he was asleep.

He woke up to someone scraping across the floor on their way to the bathroom. He opened his eyes and blinked away the light flooding his vision. Kaminari was long gone – his side of the couch was cold.

In his place, Kaminari had tucked the second earbud into Shinsou’s ear. On the coffee table in front of him, Shinsou’s polaroid camera lay on its side and next to it, a single photo; Shinsou, asleep on the couch, illuminated by the glow of the iPod.

Scrawled across the bottom in Kaminari’s sloppy handwriting read; Absolute.

No, he couldn’t remember what they were doing or what was said, but he could remember how it made him feel. Kaminari covering him, watching his back. For the first time in a long time, Shinsou felt…safe. Like there was someone he could trust.

It was usually a rare feeling for him, but not when he was around Kaminari.

summary: Hey could I get a match up?  I'm a 5ft8 bi girl with pretty low self esteem. That goes to say that I'm an introvert but with a...
question: Hey could I get a match up?  I'm a 5ft8 bi girl with pretty low self esteem. That goes to say that I'm an introvert but with a mum friend instinct. Beyond that I enjoy drama, comedy, kick boxing, jokes and learning new things. I'm probably way to competitive and try achieve well in everything but I can also be super lazy and not get anything done. I have a habit of bursting into song a lot too... I do a lot of stuff outside of school with for people in my area to help out.  Thank you soo much 💕
answer:
I would pair you up with Momo! Momo is always happy to help train beside you since it’s great to learn many fighting techniques. Also, you two are both mom friends, like you two constantly try to take care of each other. Too sleepy, cuddles with Momo. Momo needs to relax you already whipped up her favorite tea. Momo can be competitive at times, she’s always up for a new challenge and loves to better herself, you help inspire her as well! Though after a hard day, she’s totally fine with resting her head on her shoulder and relaxing with you, some movies playing in the background. Momo likes to burst out in songs with you as well, maybe dance with you as well!  Momo loves to help out people, so she loves to work beside you to help others!



I hope you enjoyed and have a great day!

summary: hi, could i have a match-up, please? i'm 5' 4", korean, and i like to wear comfortable clothing (ex. sweater + sweatpants).  i...
question: hi, could i have a match-up, please? i'm 5' 4", korean, and i like to wear comfortable clothing (ex. sweater + sweatpants).  i also wear circle glasses.  i like tiramisu, classical music, and napping.  i'm heavily self-conscious, have depression and anxiety, and i get nervous easily.  i'm also blunt and direct, and i have a hard time trusting someone.  i have few friends, but i adore them with all my heart!  i play the cello, piano, and i love cute notebooks, pens, and art supplies.  thank you!!
answer:
I would pair you up with Shinsou! He’s an avid lover of comfy clothing so you two are always recommending different clothing brands with the softest material. Every need a cuddle, ask Shinsou and with a blush, he’s happy to just sleep beside you. Shinsou tends to feel self-conscious about himself and his quirk so he can understand your own feelings and you two could talk over your problems while eating some tiramisu. Shinsou likes when people can be blunt with him, it makes talking easier with him. Shinsou secretly likes cute things, so he probably has a drawer in his room filled with cute cat stationary which he lends you time to time. Shinsou can enjoy classical music so getting a live performance of you playing classical music is super impressive! He just enjoys being with his beautiful girlfriend!



I hope you enjoyed and have a great day!

summary: Match-up maybe? I'm a 5'4 lesbian with pink hair and pale skin. I'm from America but my roots dig back to Scotland (Like Mary...
question: Match-up maybe? I'm a 5'4 lesbian with pink hair and pale skin. I'm from America but my roots dig back to Scotland (Like Mary Queen of Scots roots). I love drawing and I love animated movies and shows. I also really like playing childhood flash games like Club Penguin and Poptropica and shit lmaoo. I also dance, mostly ballet, but I wanna learn more modern and hip hop.  Thank u!!
answer:
I would match you up with Mina! Mina loves to draw up cute outfit ideas so she would love to get some drawing tips from her beautiful girlfriend. Mina gets super enthusiastic about her favorite animated shows so she loves to excitedly sit down with popcorn and talk about her favorite shows with you. Mina basically plays club penguin just to dress her penguin in cute clothes and definitely befriended you first in the game. Mina’s dream is to just ballroom dance with you or she loves to just dance around with you and have some good fun. She would love to teach your hip hop dance but, you need to teach her some ballet as well. Basically, whenever you perform a certain dance move correctly, Mina rewards you with some hugs and kisses.


I hope you enjoyed and have a great day!

summary: BnHA Chapter 183: The Rest of the Cultural Festival
title: BnHA Chapter 183: The Rest of the Cultural Festival
body:
Previously on BnHA: Class 1-A brought the fucking house down. The band played their hearts out and the act literally opened with a bang thanks to the resident human incendiary device on drums. The dancers did their thing, and Aoyama played the role of both fireworks and disco ball. Sero, Mineta, and Todoroki combined their quirks to create paths of ice over the audience’s heads. Momo then shot out a bunch of confetti, and Ochako dove into the crowd and floated a bunch of people to have a dance party in mid-air. Iida doing the robot was the highlight of the chapter and indeed the whole manga, but Jirou was a close second, with an adorable flashback to when she first told her parents she wanted to be a hero instead of a musician, and they were the most supportive EVER, and it was amazing. Even the surly upperclassmen were won over by class A’s general vibe of awesomeness, and everyone danced their hearts out, and Eri was THRILLED and her smile was brighter than the sun and Mirio cried and oh my gosh you guys. I just feel bad for the rest of the classes that have to follow this act now lmao.

Today on BnHA: Class 1-B puts on the most audacious fanfiction-turned-stage-play since Harry Potter and the Cursed Child. All Might informs Deku that he has 47 missed calls and next time would it kill him to PICK UP HIS GODDAMN CELL PHONE jesus christ. Hounddog rips Deku a new one and tells him to be more careful in the future and throws him 20 feet into the air and tells him to go have fun. Eri is so fucking cute that I almost burst into tears just from how cute she is. The surly upperclassmen apologize for their shit attitudes and vow to spread the word of how class 1-A is actually really fucking cool. Kendou, Kenranzaki, and Hadou battle it out for the Miss Con title and Hadou finally wins the title after three years. The kids enjoy the rest of the festival, and Deku gives Eri a homemade candy apple before bidding her farewell. Down at the station, a nice gorilla man sits with with the detailed Gentle and Aiba. Gentle explains that Aiba was never directly involved in any crimes and accepts responsibility for his misdeeds, thus taking his first steps towards rehabilitation.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 207 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)


  • okeedoke, I’m back and ready to finish up this arc and enter the next one which has been much-hyped thus far!
  • but first, class 1-B’s copyright-infringing play!



  • I really didn’t think chapter 182 could be topped, but somehow 183 has managed to do it in a single page. I’m speechless
  • also, the fact that they’ve literally done the “I am your father scene” here kind of makes the Dad for One theory slightly less likely
  • – OR DOES IT. maybe this is just meant to throw us off our guard! I won’t give up!!
  • and now everyone’s walking out afterwards and either critiquing it or talking about how awesome and funny it was
  • Kaminari is sad because class A didn’t get to see it because they were cleaning everything up from their program. awww
  • and meanwhile Deku is getting chewed out by his dad



  • “is he getting scolded?” YES
  • and he really has no excuse. he could have called, but he made a conscious decision not to. sure, it all worked out in the end, but he didn’t know that ahead of time! DEKU YOU’RE SO IRRESPONSIBLE

(ETA: apparently he forgot his phone. supposedly. I missed that line the first time around, but I have my suspicions as to whether or not that’s true though. phones these days are practically an extension of your body. I don’t care how much of a hurry you’re in, how do you just forget it?? you’d feel that it’s not in your pocket! I practically have a freaking anxiety attack if I so much as go downstairs to my building’s laundry room without my own phone. like holy shit what if I miss a text during the two and a half minutes it will take me to move my clothes from the washer to the dryer fffff.

anyway my point is that whether he forgot it or not, he’s still irresponsible. DEKU)

  • by the way is Shouto burning something in the background here? and Katsuki too. you guys were looking forward to this cleanup huh
  • so now Deku’s apologizing, and the sad thing is he probably is truly sorry. and yet you know that the very next time a situation like this comes along, he’s going to do the exact same thing
  • really, All Might just needs to not sign any more of those permission slips. he’s grounded. you’re grounded, Deku
  • and now Hounddog and Ecto are walking over
  • HAHAHAHA



  • gotta make sure all the kids are still terrified of you, huh
  • good lord this man has no concept of personal space



  • All Might is always lucking out, having other teachers nearby who are actually willing to be the bad cop. at least someone out here is laying down the law
  • anyway, Hounddog is of course 100% right and he’s the one Deku should really be apologizing to
  • hoLY SHIT



  • I need to do some rearranging of my favorite U.A. faculty list



  • truly, no one is safe
  • lmao Sero says he’s gonna call Deku “My First Errand” from now on omggggg. if y’all want to see some cute shit go google “hajimete no otsukai.” there’s a whole tv show about it. you can usually find a few subbed episodes on Dailymotion if nothing else (for instance here’s one). this is the show that makes you realize that four-year-old Katsuki and Izuku wandering in the woods with their friends really isn’t anything out of the ordinary. and it’s filled with adorable crybabies and also some really precocious kids who make me feel incompetent somehow despite being more than 30 years older than them
  • anyways HERE’S ERI



  • is someone videotaping this. please tell me someone’s videotaping this. these are precious childhood memories
  • also LOOK AT MIRIO COPYING HER HAND GESTURES I CAN’T. I’M GOING TO DIE. OF CUTENESS
  • my god I want to make it my icon so bad but it’s a giant spoiler so I can’t ;______; [reaches out longingly to the two of them]
  • waaaaaah anyways
  • Deku is wiping his eyes because OF COURSE he started crying but he doesn’t want her to see lol
  • and he says he’s glad she enjoyed it
  • [folds chin in hands] I’m just going to enjoy this for as long as possible. life is good. in this moment, everything is perfect
  • aaaaaand now Mineta is running over and screaming at Deku for not helping them clean up
  • I really want to be mad at him for ruining the moment and also just for being Mineta in general. but there’s nothing worse than someone who just sits around goofing off while everyone else is working hard, so I can begrudgingly relate. STOP HANGING OUT WITH THE CUTE KID AND HELP US. you can hang out with the cute kid later Deku
  • a bunch of kids are walking by (I guess on their way back from the play) and waving at class A and saying their program was awesome and they loved it
  • Kirishima is thrilled and he’s grinning and thanking them
  • well LOOK WHO IT IS



  • DO YOU TWO HAVE ANYTHING YOU WOULD LIKE TO SAY



  • oh shit
  • lmao they made Kacchan’s day



  • YES THERE FUCKING WAS. THEY PURPOSELY GOT WITHIN KATSUKI’S HEARING RANGE TO TRASH HIM AND HIS CLASS ALL PASSIVE AGGRESSIVELY FOR NO REASON. THEY KNOW WHAT THEY DID
  • it’s good that they apologized for it. although we may need to watch out now and make sure that it hasn’t gone to this one’s head lol
  • Kiri’s turning to Iida and asking if those were the stressed out people Aizawa was talking about
  • oh my god Iida why are you so cute



  • sometimes I forget how much I love Iida and then he makes this face and my heart belongs to him
  • now Iida is saying that some people didn’t get a chance to see their performance and thus might still be stressed and so they need to continue to do their best or whatever
  • but the random bystanders are saying that they understand class A’s feelings and what their intention was when planning all this, and now that spirit has been passed on to them
  • and so they’re going to pass those sentiments along to others! hooray. pay it forward
  • and also surely someone got the performance on video too?? I NEED THERE TO BE VIDEOS OF EVERYTHING OKAY
  • Mina is happily elbowing Jirou and saying she must be pleased
  • and now Iida is bowing at a full 90-degree angle and saying they are forever grateful. lol this guy
  • Bakugou says he’s not grateful, and it seems he wants to give whoever didn’t bother to come to their performance a piece of his mind. lol this kid
  • now Mineta is screaming at people again to help him finish up cleaning
  • and it turns out it’s because he doesn’t want to miss the Miss Con
  • and now we’re at Miss Con! I guess
  • YESSSS GO KENDOU



  • IT’S SO STUPID TO DO THAT IN A FUCKING BALLGOWN BUT GODDAMN SHE’S SO BADASS THOUGH
  • but now Lashes is riding in on a giant tank in the shape of her face



  • have to say this is one of the more surreal things that’s happened in this manga thus far
  • (ETA: nothing to see here guys. just normal beauty pageant stuff. martial arts and tanks)
  • AHHHHHHHH



  • IS ERI SITTING ON DEKU’S LAP I CAN’T OMG I’M DYING AGAIN. MY SOUL IS LEAVING MY BODY. I’M SO CONTENT. I FEEL AT PEACE
  • Monoma’s watching everything with a weird face, and meanwhile Kirishima is congratulating him and Tetsu on how their play went. and Tetsu’s congratulating him on the concert. nothin’ but good vibes here
  • here comes Hadou!
  • her classmates are rooting for her and Tamaki is folded over about to be consumed by nerves lol



  • deep breaths, Tamaki. deep breaths

body_abstract:
Previously on BnHA: Class 1-A brought the fucking house down. The band played their hearts out and the act literally opened with a bang thanks to the resident human incendiary device on drums. The dancers did their thing, and Aoyama played the role of both fireworks and disco ball. Sero, Mineta, and Todoroki combined their quirks to create paths of ice over the audience’s heads. Momo then shot out a bunch of confetti, and Ochako dove into the crowd and floated a bunch of people to have a dance party in mid-air. Iida doing the robot was the highlight of the chapter and indeed the whole manga, but Jirou was a close second, with an adorable flashback to when she first told her parents she wanted to be a hero instead of a musician, and they were the most supportive EVER, and it was amazing. Even the surly upperclassmen were won over by class A’s general vibe of awesomeness, and everyone danced their hearts out, and Eri was THRILLED and her smile was brighter than the sun and Mirio cried and oh my gosh you guys. I just feel bad for the rest of the classes that have to follow this act now lmao.

Today on BnHA: Class 1-B puts on the most audacious fanfiction-turned-stage-play since Harry Potter and the Cursed Child. All Might informs Deku that he has 47 missed calls and next time would it kill him to PICK UP HIS GODDAMN CELL PHONE jesus christ. Hounddog rips Deku a new one and tells him to be more careful in the future and throws him 20 feet into the air and tells him to go have fun. Eri is so fucking cute that I almost burst into tears just from how cute she is. The surly upperclassmen apologize for their shit attitudes and vow to spread the word of how class 1-A is actually really fucking cool. Kendou, Kenranzaki, and Hadou battle it out for the Miss Con title and Hadou finally wins the title after three years. The kids enjoy the rest of the festival, and Deku gives Eri a homemade candy apple before bidding her farewell. Down at the station, a nice gorilla man sits with with the detailed Gentle and Aiba. Gentle explains that Aiba was never directly involved in any crimes and accepts responsibility for his misdeeds, thus taking his first steps towards rehabilitation.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 207 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)

trail.content:
Previously on BnHA: Class 1-A brought the fucking house down. The band played their hearts out and the act literally opened with a bang thanks to the resident human incendiary device on drums. The dancers did their thing, and Aoyama played the role of both fireworks and disco ball. Sero, Mineta, and Todoroki combined their quirks to create paths of ice over the audience’s heads. Momo then shot out a bunch of confetti, and Ochako dove into the crowd and floated a bunch of people to have a dance party in mid-air. Iida doing the robot was the highlight of the chapter and indeed the whole manga, but Jirou was a close second, with an adorable flashback to when she first told her parents she wanted to be a hero instead of a musician, and they were the most supportive EVER, and it was amazing. Even the surly upperclassmen were won over by class A’s general vibe of awesomeness, and everyone danced their hearts out, and Eri was THRILLED and her smile was brighter than the sun and Mirio cried and oh my gosh you guys. I just feel bad for the rest of the classes that have to follow this act now lmao.

Today on BnHA: Class 1-B puts on the most audacious fanfiction-turned-stage-play since Harry Potter and the Cursed Child. All Might informs Deku that he has 47 missed calls and next time would it kill him to PICK UP HIS GODDAMN CELL PHONE jesus christ. Hounddog rips Deku a new one and tells him to be more careful in the future and throws him 20 feet into the air and tells him to go have fun. Eri is so fucking cute that I almost burst into tears just from how cute she is. The surly upperclassmen apologize for their shit attitudes and vow to spread the word of how class 1-A is actually really fucking cool. Kendou, Kenranzaki, and Hadou battle it out for the Miss Con title and Hadou finally wins the title after three years. The kids enjoy the rest of the festival, and Deku gives Eri a homemade candy apple before bidding her farewell. Down at the station, a nice gorilla man sits with with the detailed Gentle and Aiba. Gentle explains that Aiba was never directly involved in any crimes and accepts responsibility for his misdeeds, thus taking his first steps towards rehabilitation.


(As always, all comments not marked with an ETA are my unspoiled reactions from my first readthrough of this chapter. I’ve read up through chapter 207 now, so any ETAs will reflect that.)


  • okeedoke, I’m back and ready to finish up this arc and enter the next one which has been much-hyped thus far!
  • but first, class 1-B’s copyright-infringing play!



  • I really didn’t think chapter 182 could be topped, but somehow 183 has managed to do it in a single page. I’m speechless
  • also, the fact that they’ve literally done the “I am your father scene” here kind of makes the Dad for One theory slightly less likely
  • – OR DOES IT. maybe this is just meant to throw us off our guard! I won’t give up!!
  • and now everyone’s walking out afterwards and either critiquing it or talking about how awesome and funny it was
  • Kaminari is sad because class A didn’t get to see it because they were cleaning everything up from their program. awww
  • and meanwhile Deku is getting chewed out by his dad



  • “is he getting scolded?” YES
  • and he really has no excuse. he could have called, but he made a conscious decision not to. sure, it all worked out in the end, but he didn’t know that ahead of time! DEKU YOU’RE SO IRRESPONSIBLE

(ETA: apparently he forgot his phone. supposedly. I missed that line the first time around, but I have my suspicions as to whether or not that’s true though. phones these days are practically an extension of your body. I don’t care how much of a hurry you’re in, how do you just forget it?? you’d feel that it’s not in your pocket! I practically have a freaking anxiety attack if I so much as go downstairs to my building’s laundry room without my own phone. like holy shit what if I miss a text during the two and a half minutes it will take me to move my clothes from the washer to the dryer fffff.

anyway my point is that whether he forgot it or not, he’s still irresponsible. DEKU)

  • by the way is Shouto burning something in the background here? and Katsuki too. you guys were looking forward to this cleanup huh
  • so now Deku’s apologizing, and the sad thing is he probably is truly sorry. and yet you know that the very next time a situation like this comes along, he’s going to do the exact same thing
  • really, All Might just needs to not sign any more of those permission slips. he’s grounded. you’re grounded, Deku
  • and now Hounddog and Ecto are walking over
  • HAHAHAHA



  • gotta make sure all the kids are still terrified of you, huh
  • good lord this man has no concept of personal space



  • All Might is always lucking out, having other teachers nearby who are actually willing to be the bad cop. at least someone out here is laying down the law
  • anyway, Hounddog is of course 100% right and he’s the one Deku should really be apologizing to
  • hoLY SHIT



  • I need to do some rearranging of my favorite U.A. faculty list



  • truly, no one is safe
  • lmao Sero says he’s gonna call Deku “My First Errand” from now on omggggg. if y’all want to see some cute shit go google “hajimete no otsukai.” there’s a whole tv show about it. you can usually find a few subbed episodes on Dailymotion if nothing else (for instance here’s one). this is the show that makes you realize that four-year-old Katsuki and Izuku wandering in the woods with their friends really isn’t anything out of the ordinary. and it’s filled with adorable crybabies and also some really precocious kids who make me feel incompetent somehow despite being more than 30 years older than them
  • anyways HERE’S ERI

  • also LOOK AT MIRIO COPYING HER HAND GESTURES I CAN’T. I’M GOING TO DIE. OF CUTENESS

  • Deku is wiping his eyes because OF COURSE he started crying but he doesn’t want her to see lol
  • and he says he’s glad she enjoyed it
  • [folds chin in hands] I’m just going to enjoy this for as long as possible. life is good. in this moment, everything is perfect

  • I really want to be mad at him for ruining the moment and also just for being Mineta in general. but there’s nothing worse than someone who just sits around goofing off while everyone else is working hard, so I can begrudgingly relate. STOP HANGING OUT WITH THE CUTE KID AND HELP US. you can hang out with the cute kid later Deku
